alert.note: Alert for Carlton, South St. Louis; Central St. Louis; Crow Wing; Northern Aitkin; South Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Itasca, northern Aitkin, southern St. Louis, northwestern Carlton and eastern Crow Wing Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 144 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Swatara, to 8 miles north of Libby, to 7 miles south of Floodwood, to near Fond Du Lac Band Sawyer Area, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cloquet, Floodwood, Brookston and Fond Du Lac Band Brookston Area around 150 AM CDT. Jacobson and Saginaw around 155 AM CDT. Swan River around 200 AM CDT. Warba, Meadowlands and Canyon around 205 AM CDT. Cohasset, Toivola and Pokegama Lake around 210 AM CDT. Grand Rapids, Nashwauk, Cotton, Gunn and Pengilly around 215 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Gowan, Comstock Lake, Grand Lake, Blackberry, Waukenabo, Calumet, Kelsey, Swan Lake, Bovey and Sawyer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Carlton, South St. Louis; Central St. Louis; Crow Wing; Northern Aitkin; South Itasca
